captions.text: Welcome to the League of Legends Champion Spotlight featuring Talon, the Blade’s Shadow.
Talon is a melee assassin. He utilizes stealth, speed, and a wealth of crowd control effects to take down his enemies, one at a time.
Talon’s passive is Mercy. Talon deals bonus damage to enemies who are slowed, stunned, or rooted in place.
Noxian Diplomacy causes Talon’s next attack to deal bonus damage and inflict a bleed on the target.
This bleed deals damage and reveals the target over the next few seconds.
Activating Noxian Diplomacy resets Talon’s attack timer, so using it immediately after landing a basic attack will increase your damage output.
Rake sends out a wave of blades that return immediately after. These blades damage and slow all enemies they encounter.
Cutthroat causes Talon to blink to target enemy. Immediately after blinking, the target is silenced and receives bonus damage from Talon for a short time.
Shadow Assault is Talon’s ultimate. On activation, Talon sends out a ring of blades and turns invisible.
While invisible, Talon enjoys bonus movement speed.
After a few seconds, or after attacking a target, Talon re-appears and the blades rush back to him.
These blades damage all enemies they hit both on the way out and back to Talon.
I face Nidalee in top lane. I generally have enough mana to constantly harass with Cutthroat, Rake, and Noxian Diplomacy.
I focus on killing minions but always jump on her whenever I can. Once she gets low, I use Shadow Assault to catch up to her.
Walking past her, Shadow Assault and Rake deal a ton of damage. Afraid she’ll retreat, I take her down with a Flash and pick up the kill securely.
As I attempt to get back home, Lee Sin comes to gank me. Check out how I escape.
I jump to him with Cutthroat when the minions arrive, so he can’t slow me yet.
Then I immediately land Rake and keep running. I then move so that the caster minions block his chance at landing Resonating Strike.
Once he breaks free, I know he will immediately toss it out, so I juke to the right and make it out safe.
We get into a teamfight in the jungle. I hop into Nidalee and burst her down, immediately using Shadow Assault to evade any counter attacks.
I head over to Vayne, eventually taking her down with Rake as she runs.
Afterward, I’m afraid of Alistar, so I tag him with the silence from Cutthroat and then move on to take down Lee Sin.
We get into another teamfight in the river. Alistar gets caught and dies quickly.
We push onto Kayle and when I get kicked out by Lee Sin, I chase with Flash.
Taking down Kayle, I move on and find Vayne. I know we’ll win this fight, so I’m trying to clean up kills.
I use Cutthroat to prevent her escape, but she Flashes first, which results in me dying.
Our opponents make a comeback and have taken down some of my teammates.
Thankfully, Talon shines brightest when your opponents have no cooldowns.
Right away I jump Nidalee because she’s low and a large damage threat.
I then misclick and Exhaust Alistar instead of Vayne. Thankfully, Jarvan knocks her up and we get both kills.
Afterwards I move onto Kayle who has no chance to escape thanks to Jarvan’s Exhaust.
Lee Sin joins the fray, who gets greedy when he sees Jarvan get low. Greed causes his demise and I get a quadrakill!
Because Talon has good burst damage, he works really well in coordinated ganks.
As Warwick and Twisted Fate get into range, I jump in with Cutthroat and take her down with Rake and Noxian Diplomacy.
As an assassin, you have to do a good job of estimating your opponents. Making a wrong move will get you killed for no benefit.
Here I’ve been harassing Nidalee and I think I can kill her.
Unfortunately, as I dive her on the turret, she gets healed by Soraka’s Wish and Exhausts me, preventing me from dealing enough damage to kill her.
I’m not sure I could have Flashed out, but either way I should have known both Exhaust and Wish were up.
Talon does have some sweet escape tools. I get caught by Brand and Nidalee.
Instead of panicking and Flashing right away, I just pop Shadow Assault, using the movement speed and stealth to create a gap.
Nidalee does chase me, so I finally do Flash over the wall to make it out.
I push Nidalee to her turret and use Talon’s largest burst combo. I Flash into range and use Cutthroat.
First I hit her with Rake, giving me two damage amplifications.
Then I pop Shadow Assault and immediately attack, causing the blades to hit her twice while I deal bonus damage.
I didn’t even land Noxian Diplomacy and still dealt over 500 damage in an instant.
Shadow Asssault has a number of clever uses. I see Miss Fortune out of position in mid.
I lead with Cutthroat, then Rake, so that my passive will give me extra damage for Noxian Diplomacy.
Then I pop Shadow Assault and wait for cooldowns.
Warwick does show up to help kill her, but I could have taken her down with the second half of Shadow Assault and the freshly cooled Noxian Diplomacy.
Assassins also have to pay attention to crowd controls in large fights.
While jumping onto Soraka with the silence from Cutthroat was probably the best target, it was also right next to the enemy Warwick.
He tags me with Infinite Duress and suppresses me until I die.
For runes I take armor penetration marks, flat armor seals, flat magic resist glyphs, and flat health regeneration quintessences.
This setup is aimed at giving me the best laning presence, which is Talon’s biggest weakness.
My masteries are 21/0/9, taking pretty typical physical damage buffs, along with mastering Exhaust and taking Flash.
I max Rake first for its increased slow and damage, which also allows me to farm minions really easily.
I max Noxian Diplomacy after, interrupted by a point in Cutthroat at level 3. Basically I’m just trying to get as much damage output as I can early on.
For items, I open with Doran’s Shield. If you’re having trouble early on, a Doran’s Blades or two can hold you over while you build Berserker’s Greaves.
After, I grab Youmuu’s Ghostblade as soon as possible and transition into my bigger damage items with Bloodthirster and Infinity Edge.
There are two items that I consider must-buy on Talon: Frozen Mallet will slow enemies on every attack, which guarantees your passive damage increase.
Quicksilver Sash is the only way for you to remove Exhaust, so if you get stopped by enemy summoner spells, make sure to grab this item.
Thanks for tuning into the Talon Champion Spotlight. Please subscribe to the Riot Games YouTube channel up top and leave us a comment just below the video.

comments.text:
As a previous Talon main, I can say this nerf was beyond well deserved. I 
mean come on people, his silence was a damage amplification that literally 
removed all counterplay to his champion. You can't outplay someone who 
silences you and can get his full combo off and kill you BEFORE the silence 
ends, he is the champion in ranked that I have the most consecutive 
pentakills on, being still an absolute monster in teamfights for his 
ability to jump immediately onto a carry and kill them instantly. Guys, 
talon is still really strong, he just has the ability to be counter played 
now, which is something he desperately needed. He just ruined every mid 
that tried to go against him. 

My Talon Build in terms of item priorities: 
Crystal flasks 3 pots start of the game
Brutalizer
Tiamat
Ravenous hydra
Ghost blade
Boots of mobility/counterplay boots ((Tabi, mercs)) 
B.F sword
IE or BT 
LW or IE or BT ((Depending on enemy team builds armor))
GA or LW or IE or BT ((there really isn't a need for GA if you're already 
so far ahead you can't be killed)) 


That is plenty enough to just show you talon decimates people.﻿

his abilities would be Back Strike:
when Du attacks an enemy with a basic attack he can activate it to mark

passes by them and stopping right next to them dealing physical damage and

comments.text:
Tbh... I didn't play league til s3 and I never know how much burst he can 
do back then. But from I heard from his 1st patch was a nerf on his Q due 
to the fact saying that it "doing to much damage" and also nerf his ult due 
to the fact it to strong in "team fight." The second patch I saw on him was 
another nerf on his Q saying that his Q is still to strong but they lower 
the cd on his ult. Tbh I feel like Talon is underplay, weak early game, 
gets poke to hard, and his W is weak early game. But in a late game becomes 
really strong. Don't get me wrong, I love talon because he was my first 
champ to get a penta in a normal game. But in this meta, he's just 
underplay and which makes me sad :/﻿

comments.text:
+Nieminen Eminem I'm not talking about who's kit is best in lining phase, 
i'm talking about the usage of energy of every skill, of course, Shen is a 
non-stop kitting tank when his Q is at rank 5, and "you can't hurt me" with 
his W, but that's not the point, His Ultimate doesn't use Energy or 
something just has a very long cooldown, in other hand Talon's Ultimate has 
a very low cooldown and uses mana making it spammable, so i don't know why 
you brought Shen here, there is an abyssal difference beetween sins and 
tanks. Answering to you +Connor Chan it's less than 5-8 minutes beetween 
every comment i do, and effort, almost none, since I like the theory of the 
games, the "why's?" of every champion or things in other games. I just read 
a lot and put a little logic in these topics. Finally I disagree on Talon 
being energy based, why? the reasons are explained in previous comments, 
and I don't want to make the impression that your opinions doesn't matter; 
just that, I disagree, that's all.
comments.author: Adre Garcia

comments.text:
+Adre Garcia Shen is different thing. He is a tank and his Q and W give him 
some crazy OP sustain in the lane. He shields pokes and has infinite health 
pots from his Q.
comments.author: Nieminen Eminem

comments.text: how much time and effort do you put into these things?
comments.author: Connor Chan

comments.text:
Exactly, Shen can't spam his Ulti because he has a very long cooldown, the 
same as Zed's ulti. Talon's Ultimate is ready in less than a minute or so 
(Fully itemized) at end game, so if he would be energy based the cooldown 
will be augmented by "x" seconds, and that affects the combo that he must 
do in order to execute an low armor champion. In my opinion he's fine being 
mana based, just get used to it if the base of your complaining is the bad 
management of mana when you're in laning phase. Remember, your W must 
always hit your oponnent in order to not waste mana. Oh, last thing, 
neither Zed's Q nor Shen's E can't be spammed; Zed's Q can be used just 
three times (twice with W on) in less than 4 secs beetween cooldowns. 
Shen's E has long cooldown and only returns energy when you hit champions, 
more champs, more energy; the more the merrier.

comments.text:
Talon, Jax and Vi i would say are not expensive and do really well. So does 
Wu, while he is harder to play. If you got IP i would also buy Aatrox (easy 
to play but i think he is not as strong as the others) and Zed (very strong 
but hard to play). Renekton and Irelia are also very strong and and can 
carry games, but i would not recommand them (but maybe thats just personal 
preference, while i also have to say that that not many people play them). 
Xin is also a char that can do well, but you need to understand when you 
can go in, because you have no way to get out.
